info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 16 at 12:18PM MDT until September 16 at 3:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque NM
info.description:
* WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of central and west central New Mexico, including the following counties, in central New Mexico, western Socorro. In west central New Mexico, northeastern Catron.
* WHEN...Until 315 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1216 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Alamo. - Low water crossings in and below Dog Springs Canyon may be impacted. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Arroyos, streams, and normally dry rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes. Water in arroyos can travel many miles and take hours to reach your location from upstream rain areas.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON
